fact.field: Reaction=2 Fe(2+) + 2 H(+) + H2O2 = 2 Fe(3+) + 2 H2O; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:48712, ChEBI:CHEBI:15377, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:16240, ChEBI:CHEBI:29033, ChEBI:CHEBI:29034;

Protects DNA from oxidative damage by sequestering intracellular Fe2+ ion and storing it in the form of Fe3+ oxyhydroxide mineral. One hydrogen peroxide oxidizes two Fe2+ ions, which prevents hydroxyl radical production by the Fenton reaction
Homododecamer. The 12 identical subunits form a hollow sphere into which the mineral iron core of up to 300 Fe(3+) can be deposited
Lipid-binding protein involved in the biosynthesis of coenzyme Q, also named ubiquinone, an essential lipid-soluble electron transporter for aerobic cellular respiration
Belongs to the aromatic amine dehydrogenase light chain family
Heterotetramer of two light and two heavy chains

Reaction=H2O + methylamine + 2 oxidized [amicyanin] = formaldehyde + 2 H(+) + NH4(+) + 2 reduced [amicyanin]; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:30207, Rhea:RHEA-COMP:11100, Rhea:RHEA-COMP:11101, ChEBI:CHEBI:15377, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:16842, ChEBI:CHEBI:28938, ChEBI:CHEBI:29036, ChEBI:CHEBI:49552, ChEBI:CHEBI:59338; EC=1.4.9.1;
Methylamine dehydrogenase carries out the oxidation of methylamine. Electrons are passed from methylamine dehydrogenase to amicyanin
One-carbon metabolism; methylamine degradation; formaldehyde from methylamine: step 1/1

meta.information: the Cobalt is used by anaerobic bacteria

fact.field: Belongs to the precorrin methyltransferase family

Reaction=Co-precorrin-2 + S-adenosyl-L-methionine = Co-precorrin-3 + H(+) + S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:17997, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:57856, ChEBI:CHEBI:59789, ChEBI:CHEBI:60053, ChEBI:CHEBI:60060; EC=2.1.1.151;
Methylates cobalt-precorrin-2 at the C-20 position to produce cobalt-precorrin-3A in the anaerobic cobalamin biosynthesis pathway

Reaction=precorrin-2 + S-adenosyl-L-methionine = H(+) + precorrin-3A + S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:16841, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:57856, ChEBI:CHEBI:58561, ChEBI:CHEBI:58827, ChEBI:CHEBI:59789; EC=2.1.1.130;
Methylates precorrin-2 at the C-20 position to produce precorrin-3A
Belongs to the actin-binding proteins ADF family. GMF subfamily

Reaction=NADP(+) + prephenate = 3-(4-hydroxyphenyl)pyruvate + CO2 + NADPH; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:21640, ChEBI:CHEBI:16526, ChEBI:CHEBI:29934, ChEBI:CHEBI:36242, ChEBI:CHEBI:57783, ChEBI:CHEBI:58349; EC=1.3.1.13;
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-tyrosine biosynthesis; (4-hydroxyphenyl)pyruvate from prephenate (NADP(+) route): step 1/1
Belongs to the prephenate/arogenate dehydrogenase family
Regulatory subunit of the condensin-2 complex, a complex which establishes mitotic chromosome architecture and is involved in physical rigidity of the chromatid axis

Reaction=4 [Fe(II)cytochrome c] + 4 H(+) + O2 = 4 [Fe(III)cytochrome c] + 2 H2O; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:11436, Rhea:RHEA-COMP:10350, Rhea:RHEA-COMP:14399, ChEBI:CHEBI:15377, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:15379, ChEBI:CHEBI:29033, ChEBI:CHEBI:29034; EC=7.1.1.9;
Name=Cu cation; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:23378; Note=Binds a copper A center
Subunits I and II form the functional core of the enzyme complex. Electrons originating in cytochrome c are transferred via heme a and Cu(A) to the binuclear center formed by heme a3 and Cu(B)
Reaction=Eliminative cleavage of (1->4)-alpha-D-galacturonan to give oligosaccharides with 4-deoxy-alpha-D-galact-4-enuronosyl groups at their non-reducing ends.; EC=4.2.2.2;
Belongs to the polysaccharide lyase 3 family

Pectinolytic enzyme consist of four classes of enzymes: pectin lyase, polygalacturonase, pectin methylesterase and rhamnogalacturonase. Among pectinolytic enzymes, pectin lyase is the most important in depolymerization of pectin, since it cleaves internal glycosidic bonds of highly methylated pectins. Favors pectate, the anion, over pectin, the methyl ester

Catalyzes the depolymerization of both polygalacturonate and pectins of methyl esterification degree from 22 to 89%, with an endo mode of action. In contrast to the majority of pectate lyases, displays high activity on highly methylated pectins
Belongs to the pseudouridine synthase RsuA family
